awd_titl_txt: A Belmont Forum Scoping Workshop on Food, Water & Energy for Sustainable Global Urbanization: Accelerating Transitions to Sustainable Consumption and Production
org_div_long_name: Integrative and Collaborative Education and Research (ICER)

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF COLORADO

por.por_cntn:
This project supported a workshop at the University of Colorado at Boulder.  This workshop included 70 participants from more than 12 countries as well as students, faculty, community members from Boulder Colorado. The workshop led to the development of a coordinated research action by the Belmont Forum focused on the Food-Water-Energy nexus in urban areas.  The provisioning of food, energy, and water to rapidly growing urban areas around the world is one of the major challenges facing society.  These problems require insight from a broad array of disciplines as well as the engagement of the research community with civil society to solve real-world problems. Through this project, we led a process to build consensus on a coordinated research agenda spanning the Belmont Forum countries. This type of consensus helps support the efficient and coordinated use of research funding to address key questions without duplication and to build synergies through international research activities. In addition to the oversight of the workshop, this project was able to support the engagement of 8 researchers from developing economies in follow on research planning activities. These researchers provide unique expertise and insight into food-water-energy problems in urban centers through Sub-Saharan Africa and their participation in the subsequent research programs will likely lead to further collaboration and international coordination.
